member.name: T:Refactor.Change
member.summary: Type representing a single script change / string replacement operation

member.name: F:Refactor.Change.Before
member.summary: The text before applying the change

member.name: F:Refactor.Change.After
member.summary: The text after applying the change

member.name: F:Refactor.Change.Offset
member.summary: The starting index in the source code from where to begin the replacement

member.name: F:Refactor.Change.Path
member.summary: Path of the file in which changes should be applied

member.name: F:Refactor.Change.Token
member.summary: The token generating this change

member.name: F:Refactor.Change.Data
member.summary: Any additional data that should be included in this change object

member.name: T:Refactor.CommandToken
member.summary: Object representing a single command in a script

member.name: P:Refactor.CommandToken.Type
member.summary: The kind of token this is. Must match the name of the token provider to use.

member.name: P:Refactor.CommandToken.Text
member.summary: The actual Text within the file that should be replaced after executing transform.

member.name: P:Refactor.CommandToken.StartOffset
member.summary: The start offset within the original code. Used to identify the code's position in the original text when replacing with transformed content.

member.name: F:Refactor.CommandToken.NewText
member.summary: The updated text after running the token transformation

member.name: F:Refactor.CommandToken.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters that are KNOWN to be used in the command

member.name: F:Refactor.CommandToken.ParametersKnown
member.summary: Whether we are confident having identified all the parameters used

member.name: F:Refactor.CommandToken.Splats
member.summary: Any splats used in this command

member.name: F:Refactor.CommandToken.HasSplat
member.summary: Whether this command has any splats

member.name: M:Refactor.CommandToken.#ctor(System.Management.Automation.Language.CommandAst)
member.summary: Create a new command token off a CommandAst object
member.param: The Ast off which to build the Command Token

member.name: M:Refactor.CommandToken.IsSplat(System.Management.Automation.Language.Ast)
member.summary: Whether a given Ast object is a splat.
member.returns: Whether a given Ast object is a splat.

member.name: M:Refactor.CommandToken.GetChanges
member.summary: Returns changes the token would apply. Run after calling transform
member.returns: The changes applied by this token after its transformation

member.name: T:Refactor.Host
member.summary: Global tools, data and settings related to the Refactor module library

member.name: F:Refactor.Host.ProviderCommand
member.summary: Command used to list all available token providers

member.name: F:Refactor.Host.TransformCommand
member.summary: Command used convert tokens

member.name: T:Refactor.ScriptFile
member.summary: Wrapper around a scriptfile, base from which tokens are generated and transform results are written back to

member.name: F:Refactor.ScriptFile.Path
member.summary: Path to the file being processed

member.name: F:Refactor.ScriptFile.Ast
member.summary: Original AST of the file being processed

member.name: F:Refactor.ScriptFile.Modifiers
member.summary: Any modification loci and length that have previously been applied to the file. This is to ensure, that anything modified does not affect other transformations that were generated before said modification.

member.name: F:Refactor.ScriptFile.Content
member.summary: Actual string content of the file after modifications

member.name: P:Refactor.ScriptFile.Saved
member.summary: Whether the current modifications have been written back to file

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptFile.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Generate a new scriptfile object off the path to a scriptfile
member.param: Path to the file being wrapped

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptFile.Reload
member.summary: Applies the current state of the wrapped file to this in-memory object

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptFile.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes back the current Content back to file, saving all modifications applied so far.
member.param: Whether to create a backup of the previous state. This will create a copy of that file in the same folder with ".backup" appended to the name.

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptFile.GetEffectiveIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returnes the starting index (or offset) in a file for a given original index, after taking modifications into consideration.
member.param: Index number as originally parsed out of the file
member.returns: The effective index number / offset to use instead for the current state.

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptFile.GetTokens
member.summary: Returns a list of all tokens, generated from all token providers that have been registered

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptFile.Transform(Refactor.ScriptToken[])
member.summary: Apply all transforms to the tokens specified
member.returns: A result object, reporting the state of each individual transformation

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptFile.GetAst(System.String)
member.summary: Get the Ast representing the code in the file specified. Ignores all syntax errors
member.param: Path to the file to parse
member.returns: The Ast object representing the file specified

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptFile.GetStringContent(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Safely returns the substring of the input string without exception. Bad indexes will result in either an empty string or a string of unexpected length.
member.param: The start index from where to read

member.name: T:Refactor.ScriptToken
member.summary: The base class for token objects. Extend from this if you want to define your own custom token type

member.name: F:Refactor.ScriptToken.Name
member.summary: Name of the token. Used for identifying transforms and matched against their index.

member.name: F:Refactor.ScriptToken.Ast
member.summary: AST object representing the code content of the Token. Is optional

member.name: P:Refactor.ScriptToken.Type
member.summary: The kind of token this is. Must match the name of the token provider to use.

member.name: F:Refactor.ScriptToken.AllowPartial
member.summary: Whether the changes wrought by the token can be applied if only some of them remainvalid

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptToken.Transform
member.summary: Convert the token-related text by applying transformation rule as implemented by the provider
member.returns: The new text that should replace the original text represented by this token.

member.name: M:Refactor.ScriptToken.GetChanges
member.summary: Returns changes the token would apply. Run after calling transform
member.returns: The changes applied by this token after its transformation

member.name: T:Refactor.Splat
member.summary: A splat object, including the resolved parameters it will potentially bind

member.name: F:Refactor.Splat.Ast
member.summary: Ast of the splat binding. NOT of where the hashtable is first declared, but where it is ultimately used.

member.name: F:Refactor.Splat.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters bound through the splat

member.name: F:Refactor.Splat.ParametersKnown
member.summary: Whether we can authoratively claim to know which parameters may be bound through this splat.

member.name: T:Refactor.TokenProvider
member.summary: All the information needed to process a specific tokentype

member.name: F:Refactor.TokenProvider.Name
member.summary: Name of the provider

member.name: F:Refactor.TokenProvider.TransformIndex
member.summary: The property to use for indexing transforms

member.name: F:Refactor.TokenProvider.TransformParametersMandatory
member.summary: The parameters that must be specified when registering transforms

member.name: F:Refactor.TokenProvider.TransformParameters
member.summary: The parameters that may be specified when registering transforms. Use to build out dynamic parameters for the specific register call

member.name: F:Refactor.TokenProvider.Tokenizer
member.summary: Code that parses an Ast provided and generates tokens from it

member.name: F:Refactor.TokenProvider.Converter
member.summary: Code that takes a token and applies relevant transforms to it

member.name: T:Refactor.TransformationResult
member.summary: Result of all changes applied to a single file

member.name: F:Refactor.TransformationResult.Path
member.summary: path to the file being transformed

member.name: P:Refactor.TransformationResult.FileName
member.summary: Name of the file being transformed

member.name: P:Refactor.TransformationResult.Success
member.summary: Whether the transformation was 100 successful

member.name: P:Refactor.TransformationResult.Count
member.summary: Count of transformations executed

member.name: P:Refactor.TransformationResult.SuccessCount
member.summary: Count of successful transformations executed

member.name: F:Refactor.TransformationResult.Results
member.summary: All individual transformation results that have been applied - successful or otherwise

member.name: M:Refactor.TransformationResult.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new transformation result report
member.param: Path to the script file being transformed

member.name: T:Refactor.TransformationResultEntry
member.summary: Result of a single token transformation

member.name: F:Refactor.TransformationResultEntry.Success
member.summary: Whether the transformation was successful

member.name: F:Refactor.TransformationResultEntry.Change
member.summary: The change implemented

member.name: F:Refactor.TransformationResultEntry.Token
member.summary: The Token the transformation was applied to

member.name: F:Refactor.TransformationResultEntry.Message
member.summary: Any message included in the transformation

member.name: F:Refactor.TransformationResultEntry.Error
member.summary: Any errors that happened during execution

member.name: F:Refactor.TransformationResultEntry.Path
member.summary: Path to the file being transformed

member.name: M:Refactor.TransformationResultEntry.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new, empty transformation result entry

member.summary: Create a new, filled out transformation result entry

The actual change that was performed
The Token the transformation was applied to
